Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Lonnie Juli
Reviews.Content: I own 4 of these. Good value for money. Nice selection of inputs. Sharp, contrasty, bright video. Adequate audio levels.Caveat: vertical viewing angle is a bit narrow. If you need a large vertical angle, this monitor isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: A great little set, perfect in many cases -- despite its limitations
Reviews.Author: J. Holman
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviewers are saying: this set's viewing angle means that if you aren't able to watch it straight on, the picture starts looking washed out, getting worse as you move further to the side. Its sound is also nothing to brag about, though I wouldn't call it annoying or unacceptable. But despite all that, it's a good choice in many situations.It's a logical choice for a kitchen, where a 21 or even a 19 inch set might take up too much counter or wall space. If you're spending your time chopping vegetables or in other cooking-related activities, you may not care about the best picture from every angle. It could really make sense in just about any setting where space is tight and watching TV is not the main focus (or where viewing angle won't be an issue).It could also be a useful addition to many a home theater. I have a theater room with a Mitsubishi projector and a motorized 120 inch screen. But sometimes, I don't feel like powering it all up, and waiting awhile, to see if there's something I want to watch on TCM tonight, or on Netflix or Amazon Prime, or if I should go look for a blu-ray, etc. I've thought for a while that it would be nice to see what my options are on a small TV connected to the same system. The 16 inch Viewsonic would be perfect for that purpose, especially since my counter is already crowded with remote controls and a popcorn machine (though I'd need to replace my AV receiver with one that has 2 HDMI outs, or get a box that accomplishes the same purpose).But I actually bought the Viewsonic for another purpose.I shoot video in my home video/recording studio. When I'm also the subject of the video, staring at a camera or camcorder's built in 3 or 4 inch LCD from 10 to 15 feet across the room is challenging at best. You can buy a 9 inch monitor to mount on a tripod next to your camcorder -- there are monitors designed for this purpose, but they cost $600 to $800 or more. This 16 inch Viewsonic has proved a good alternative. It's wonderfully light, yet well built, and fits nicely on a stand right next to my camcorder -- big enough, but not too big. I don't rely on it for color, exposure, etc., since those factors can shift with viewing angle. But it's great for composing a still or video image. As a bonus, it can alternatively be connected to a computer and used, with appropriate software, as a make-shift teleprompter.If you have room for a TV that's a bit larger, are concerned about the viewing angle, and don't mind paying a few extra dollars, Samsung has a 19 inch TV (its smallest set) that you may like more -- I own that one as well, and the Samsung's picture is better. Still, I'm pleased with the Viewsonic. If there was another 14 - 16 inch monitor out there that offered a better picture from a wider viewing angle, at a reasonable price, I'd buy it. But I don't think it exists.

Reviews.Title: TV/Monitor
Reviews.Author: Jerry Milbauer
Reviews.Content: Good TV for the money. Easy to use with intuitive remote. Vertical viewing angles are a little sensitive. If you are going to use this as a computer monitor be aware that the base does not have any tilting adjustment.

Reviews.Title: You can not view this at an angle
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I ordered this as it was the perfect size for the kitchen space it was to fit in.Worked well, nice picture.But - if you are not looking straight on at this, the picture is washed out.Had to send it back.

Reviews.Title: viewing angle awful
Reviews.Author: Scott Graham
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for our kitchen. We were limited to the small size due to the size of the cabinet it would be in. Might as well not have a TV at all with the picture of this TV. The stand does not tilt so straight on viewing is the only option and now I know why. The picture is awful if viewed from below or at an angle.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV
Reviews.Author: RadioRick
Reviews.Content: The size of this TV is perfect to go next to my monitor as a second monitor and to watch the news while web surfing without a TV tuner card. Previous reviews state the sound is tinny which it is but the TV is small for crying out loud. It's really not that bad. It sounds great with a set of external speakers plugged into the mini audio out jack. It doesn't have the greatest picture compared to say a Samsung but the price was good. Wouldn't want to use it as a bedroom TV etc. as the size would be too small. Overall, I like the TV and would get it again.

Reviews.Title: Not much else available in this size
Reviews.Author: Frederick L. Katz
Reviews.Content: We found this TV to be pretty much what was noted in previous ratings.  The picture is washed out unless you are looking directly at it, at eye level.  The sound is like a children's toy--very tinny.  For a small kitchen, with really no other options, this set will suffice.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Neil Whitman
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is OK, the sound is tinny. I was looking for a small TV for the Kitchen and the options were limited

Reviews.Title: Would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Joseph L. Powlette
Reviews.Content: Terrible sound. Sounds like you are in a tin can. Picture can only be seen head on;  at any angle beyond a few degrees it just washes out.

Reviews.Title: Fits the bill
Reviews.Author: Thomas Phillips
Reviews.Content: Great for the kitchen while cooking. I can see football and golf with no problem at all.  I did make a placemat with wooden shims to tilt the unit back a little for better viewing.  The sound is a slight bit tinny but not enough to ruin the event I'm watching. Picture is first class.

Reviews.Title: This is not a great screen.
Reviews.Author: PhilPRO
Reviews.Content: Frankly, mine was broken, but from what I could tell, this screen in general isn't the greatest.  The viewing angle is brutally small.

Reviews.Title: Great small monitor
Reviews.Author: Keith M. Phillips
Reviews.Content: Though I use of this product only as a display for my Oppo CD/SACD player, it performs beautifully with excellent resolution and color.  I'm sure it would function equally well as a TV monitor so long as you didn't need a large screen.  Very pleased with this unit.
